MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001357
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 18, 2024
License #: CI410298928
Licensee Group Organization: Wedgwood Christian Services
Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Ana McClain
Agency Name: EAST CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3340 36TH ST SE
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-2810
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 12/10/2024
Capacity: 47

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was AWOL from 4/9/24-4/11/24 and when they returned,
the facility staff refused to take the youth for a SANE exam at the
hospital. On 4/12/24, youth went AWOL from the hospital once
more.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source was interviewed via phone on April 19,
2024. Complaint Source reported she did not have additional
information. She reported her heard these concerns second hand
from MDHHS Worker and Foster Care Worker.
Youth A was AWOL during the entirety of this investigation
and was unable to be interviewed.
MDHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on April 19, 2024.
MDHHS Worker reported she was assigned to investigate a case
with Youth A involving human trafficking concerns. Youth A went
AWOL from the work program at the facility on April 9, 2024, and
returned to the facility on April 11, 2024. MDHHS Worker reported
a concern was reported on April 12, 2024, involving concerns of
Youth A being a victim of sexual assault during her time AWOL.
She reported on April 12, 2024, she went to the facility to meet
with Youth A. On that day she met with Supervisor 1 to gather
more information. MDHHS Worker reported she asked the
Supervisor 1 how to go about receiving a medical/SANE exam for
Youth A due to the allegation concerns. Supervisor 1 reported the
medical exam would have to go through the nursing
department and there would likely have to be two staff that
would have to transport Youth A to the exam due to her being an
AWOL risk. MDHHS Worker reported Supervisor 1 called Nurse
about setting this up. Supervisor 1 reported Nurse stated she met
with Youth A on April 11, 2024, and Youth A was asked multiple
times about getting a medical/SANE exam done and Youth A
continued to refuse any medical treatment. MDHHS Worker
reported she spoke with Foster Care Worker about the
2

situation and Foster Care Worker was going to call Youth A to
encourage her to go to the exam. She reported Foster Care
Worker got Youth A to agree to go to get the exam. MDHHS
Worker reported she and Foster Care Worker took Youth A to the
exam which resulted in Youth A going AWOL. She
reported Foster Care Worker chose to take Youth A because she
reported she would have better luck with getting Youth A to follow
through with the exam and Youth A would not AWOL on her.
MDHHS Worker reported the facility never refused to take Youth A
to the exam and just noted Youth A was refusing to go to the
exam with the facility.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via phone on April 19,
2024. Foster Care Worker reported she is Youth A’s primary foster
care worker. She reported the facility never refused to take Youth
A to get her SANE exam. Foster Care Worker reported when
Youth A returned from AWOL on April 11, 2024, the facility had
Youth A meet with Nurse, and Youth A refused to go to the
hospital or get a SANE exam. Foster Care Worker
reported she met with Youth A face to face at the facility on April
11, 2024, and Youth A disclosed while AWOL she got into a
physical fight, had sexual intercourse, and used substances.
She reported she talked to Youth A on the phone on April 12,
2024, and convinced her to get a SANE exam. Foster Care
Worker reported she was the safest person to take Youth A to the
SANE exam as she was refusing to go with the facility staff and
noted Youth A has never run away from her. She reported when
she went to transport Youth A to the SANE exam, she never
asked the facility to assist her with the transportation. Foster Care
Worker reported she was appreciative of all the work Nurse did
with Youth A and reported the facility never refused any medical
care for Youth A.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 19, 2024. Chief Administrator reported she was
involved when Youth A returned to the facility on April 11, 2024.
Upon return, Chief Administrator notified Foster Care Worker via
phone. She reported Foster Care Worker stated she did not want
Youth A to get a medical exam for potential sexual assault due
to it would be too traumatic for her. Chief Administrator reported
Youth A had some bruising and scratches on her
face which Youth A stated she was in a physical fight. She
reported she completed an incident report and Youth A stated she
did not want medical attention. Chief Administrator reported Youth
A met Nurse due to returning from AWOL. Youth A reported she
was sexually active while AWOL and denied wanting further
3

medical treatment at the hospital or through a SANE exam when
Nurse offered. She reported on April 12, 2024, Foster Care
Worker spoke with Youth A on the phone and convinced her to get
the SANE exam done. Chief Administrator reported Foster Care
worker stated that she was going to transport Youth A to the
appointment and never asked for the facility support. She reported
if the worker had asked, the facility would have transported Youth
A to the appointment with two staff due to her being an AWOL
risk.
Nurse was interviewed via phone at the facility on April 19,
2024. Nurse reported when Youth A returned from AWOL on April
11, 2024, she met with Youth A. She reported Youth A had marks
and bruises on her which Youth A disclosed she was in a physical
fight. Nurse reported she had a very involved conversation with
Youth A about the importance of getting a SANE exam to check
for sexually transmitted diseases and make sure she was healthy.
She reported Youth A continued to state she did not want to get
anyone in trouble, even when Nurse explained the exam could
just be done to check her health. Youth A continued to deny it and
wanted to take a shower. Nurse reported she could not force
Youth A to do the exam and noted there were no other major
emergency medical concerns at the time she checked her over.
She reported on April 12, 2024, she received a call from
Supervisor 1 about MDHHS Worker asking about her
conversation with Youth A. Nurse reported if Youth A was willing
to go, she would have set the exam up. She reported the facility
has a good relationship with the YWCA where the SANE exams
occur, and she has set up other exams before. Nurse reported the
facility would have also figured out safe transportation for Youth A
to any medical she needed whether that would be with two staff or
calling an ambulance.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone at the facility on April
19, 2024. Supervisor 1 reported she was involved when MDHHS
Worker arrived at the facility on April 12, 2024. She
reported MDHHS Worker asked to speak Youth A about the
concern of potential sexual assault and asked about what steps
the facility takes when a youth needs a medical exam. Supervisor
1 explained to MDHHS Worker for Youth A there would need to be
two staff to transport her because of the AWOL risk and for
medical exams, she would contact Nurse. She reported she called
Nurse to follow up and Nurse reported Youth A declined several
times to get a SANE exam or the hospital.
She reported MDHHS Worker never asked about the facility
transporting or setting up a SANE exam. Supervisor 1 reported if
4

MDHHS Worker had scheduled a SANE exam she would have
found two staff to transport Youth A. She reported
if MDHHS Worker had asked for a SANE exam
to be scheduled she would have connected with Nurse to
schedule it as the facility has done this prior for other youths.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 19, 2024. Supervisor 2 reported she was present when
Youth A returned from AWOL on April 11, 2024. She reported
Youth A appeared to be under the influence of substances and
reported she just wanted to take a shower. Supervisor 2 reported
Youth A did not take a shower because she needed to meet with
Nurse first. She reported Youth A appeared to have a black
eye and Youth A reported she was in a fight with another person
when AWOL. When Youth A returned from meeting
with Nurse she was allowed to shower as Youth A refused any
further assessment or medical treatment. Supervisor 2
reported Foster Care Worker saw Youth A on April 11, 2024, and
never expressed any concerns about needing further assessment.
Supervisor 2 reported she was aware Foster Care Worker had a
phone conversation with Youth A and got her to agree to do a
SANE exam the following day. She reported she received a phone
call from Foster Care Worker on April 12, 2024,
and she reported she was coming to pick up Youth A to transport
her to the appointment. Supervisor 2 reported she was never
asked for the facility to help support with this
transport. Supervisor 2 reported she did express concerns to
Foster Care Worker about the AWOL risk of Youth A and Foster
Care Worker responded Youth A would not run away from
her. She reported Foster Care Worker also expressed she would
transport Youth A to any other medical appointments that are
needed, and Supervisor 2 noted the facility can do this as
well. Supervisor 2 reported no one at the facility refused to
transport Youth A to the SANE exam.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on April
19, 2024. Therapist reported she met with Youth A when she
returned from AWOL on April 11, 2024. She reported she just had
a general conversation where Youth A reported she used
substances, had consensual sexual intercourse, and got into a
physical fight. Therapist reported Youth A did meet with
Nurse and Youth A denied a SANE exam. She reported the
nursing department had set up SANE exams with the YWCA
prior and the facility would have transported Youth A to the exam
if she was in agreeance with going. Therapist reported she was
made aware on April 12, 2024, that Nurse was consulted about a
5

SANE exam from Supervisor 1. She reported from her
understanding MDHHS Worker or Foster Care Worker never
asked for the facility to set up or transport Youth A to a SANE
exam.
Documents Reviewed:
- Incident Report for Youth A dated April 11, 2024-
Supervisor 2 completed this report noting Youth A returned
from AWOL and had bruising on her face, cuts on her
hands, scratches on both arms, bruises on both elbows,
and bruise on both knees. Nurse was consulted and
completed a medical assessment with Youth A.
- Nursing Note dated April 11, 2024- Nurse completed this
document. Youth a disclosed she used cocaine and had
“consensual” sexual activity. Youth A refused to be seen at
the Emergency Room or YWCA for a full assessment.
Nurse noted Youth A was strongly encouraged to
cooperate due to risks of diseases.
- Nursing Note dated April 12, 2024- Nurse documented
Foster Care Worker is going to be transporting Youth A to
the YWCA for a full assessment and noted the facility will
help with transport if needed.
- Facility’s Medical Emergencies Policy- The facility
followed the emergency policy. This policy notes that it is
the responsibility for all staff to act promptly in keeping with
the corresponding procedures as the medical assistance
occurs. The procedure notes staff are to contact nursing
on-call. Interviews confirmed this policy was followed.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews with staff and
foster care worker the facility never refused to take Youth A to the
exam, Youth A was refusing to go with staff. Staff followed the
agency’s medical policy as shown by the staff contacted Nurse
when Youth A returned back from AWOL.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
May 8, 2024
______________________________________________
Cathrine Raftery Date
Licensing Consultant
